Description: Wooden female figure with a braided tripartite wig painted black and a collar composed of multiple strands of blue glazed composition beads; long rectangular plinth inscribed with four lines of Hieroglyphic text on top and a line of Hieroglyphic text on the right-hand side. The inscriptions identify the woman as Benetreshep and the text on the side of the plinth states that the figure was dedicated by her son, whose name appears to be Seneb.
Curator's comments: British Museum, Guide to 4th, 5th and 6th Egyptian Rooms (1922), 24.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2017 - 2020, World Museum Liverpool, Long term loan 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed
